content: The seafood risotto was creamy perfection! Generous portion of prawns and mussels. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions. The restaurant was clean and well-maintained.
title: Seafood heaven
author: Claire B

content: Disappointing visit. The fish was clearly not fresh - had that fishy smell that screams old. Service was slow and our waiter seemed disinterested. Expected better for these prices.
title: Fresh fish? Think again
author: Mark D

content: Excellent breakfast spot! The eggs benedict were cooked perfectly and the hollandaise was divine. Coffee was strong and flavorful. Great way to start a day of exploring.
title: Best breakfast in town
author: Australian Visitor

content: The kids menu is fantastic - finally a restaurant that takes children's meals seriously. Not just nuggets and chips! Staff were patient with our fussy toddler. Family-friendly atmosphere.
title: Great for families
author: Mom of Three

content: Absolutely rude staff. We asked politely about vegetarian options and the waiter rolled his eyes. The mushroom risotto was cold when it arrived. Manager didn't seem to care about our complaint.
title: Rude and unprofessional
author: Vegetarian Diner

content: The wine selection is impressive - one of the best in Cape Town. The sommelier helped us find a perfect Stellenbosch red to pair with our lamb. Food was good but the wine stole the show.
title: Wine lovers paradise
author: Wine Enthusiast

content: Came for a business lunch. The set menu was good value but portions were quite small. Service was efficient which was appreciated. Clean toilets which is always a plus!
title: Decent business lunch
author: Corporate Client

content: This place needs a deep clean. Sticky menus, dirty tables, and spotted a cockroach near the bar. The food might be good but I couldn't get past the hygiene issues. Reported to management.
title: Cleanliness is a problem
author: Health Conscious

content: The chef came out to discuss dietary requirements - such personal service! My gluten-free meal was thoughtfully prepared and absolutely delicious. Felt like a VIP. Highly recommend!
title: Outstanding dietary accommodation
author: Celiac Diner

content: Middle of the road experience. Food was tasty but took ages to arrive. The view somewhat compensates for the slow service. Would consider returning but not in a rush to do so.
title: Christmas lunch was okay
author: Holiday Diner

content: The prawn curry was spicy perfection! Authentic flavors and generous prawns. Service could have been a bit faster but the food quality makes up for it. Will definitely order this again.
title: Spicy and satisfying
author: Curry Lover

content: Booked for a group of 10 and they couldn't get any of our orders right. Total chaos in the kitchen it seemed. Several dishes came out cold. Disappointing for a supposedly premium restaurant.
title: Group bookings are a mess
author: Party Organizer

content: Simple and delicious. Had the grilled linefish of the day with a side salad - perfectly cooked and fresh. No complaints about service or ambiance. Exactly what I wanted for lunch.
title: Fresh and simple
author: Seafood Fan

content: The cocktails here are creative and delicious! The bartender made us custom drinks based on our preferences. Food was secondary but still quite good. Great spot for pre-dinner drinks.
title: Fantastic cocktails
author: Cocktail Connoisseur

content: Never again. We were rushed through our meal because they wanted the table for another booking. Felt like cattle being herded. The food was fine but the experience ruined the evening.
title: Rushed and unwelcome
author: Disgruntled Diner
